content: Hey all, it's not quite meeting time yet but I can't make today's meeting time so figured I'd share my updates early. Which is to say: I'm still working on my talk, and haven't made any progress on the streams yet.
I'll read the meeting notes back tomorrow. Hope y'all have a good week!
Okay. I put up a PR for select/join here: https://github.com/rust-lang/async-book/pull/28

Hi all! I'm a bit new here but I've been hanging around the ecosystems group. I'm interested in helping out, any sections that could use some help? I see there are a few issues but none seem super active. I'm also happy to help review :)
There are a lot of things to do, and they don't seem super active because there aren't a lot of people working on it, so your help would be super appreciated! :)
feel free to pick whichever remaining todo section you feel comfortable explaining and leave a comment on the issue (or open a new corresponding issue) saying you're planning to tackle it.

Cool, let me know what would be the most valuable. I see there are a bunch of sections later on that are still TODO like modeling request/response. Are these in scope? I have a lot of experience around the ecosystem and designing applications with futures etc I could take a stab at those sections? Unless there are higher priorities.
Filling out the sections on AsyncRead and AsyncWrite would probably be the most valuable at this point, IMO
cool, ill try and take a stab at it over the next week or so :) thanks
